urls.title: ‘Organised pollution’: Sewage dumped into England’s waters 400,000 times in 2020
urls.description: Rapid action is required to turn around the fate of England’s rivers, campaigners have said, after data released by the Environment Agency (EA) revealed that water companies pumped raw sewage into English waters more than 400,000 times last year.

urls.title: Programme & Registration | Flood & Coast
urls.description: Telford International Centre, UK The 2021 Flood and Coast conference and expo will take place on Hopin, a virtual event platform designed to feel like an in-person event. Each day will be fully packed with interactive sessions, live exhibition booths and networking opportunities, with the audience addressing some of the most important issues in FCERM. Delegates will interact with speakers through the live Q & A sessions, meet with exhibitors in our live expo hall, and connect with new people through

Also considerable #floodrisk concern about houses being built in the wrong places and the loss of @EnvAgency or #IDB expert advice to protect against unsustainable development. This is creating a massive problem for future generations. @mhclg @ADA_updates @DefraGovUK @ADEPTLA https://t.co/1TgaTxpoiq

There are things you can do to prepare for flooding:

-Registering with the free flood warning service @EnvAgencyYNE 
-Know what items to move upstairs to safety
-Learn how to turn off electricity supply 
-Have a bag of essentials ready to go 

Hear Martin's story below 👇 https://t.co/QFaRJSqSgO
